tit.e: Go (unit of cubic volume approximately equal to 0.18 liters)
Go (a unit of cubic volume in old Japanese system of weights and measures originated in China)
Go (a unit of cubic volume in old Japanese system of weights and measures originated in China)

sen.j: 合（ごう）は、尺貫法における体積の単位である。
sen.e: Go is a unit of cubic volume in shakkanho (old Japanese system of weights and measures).
Go (a unit) is a unit of cubic volume in old Japanese system of weights and measures.
sen.cmt: 英語の「go」との混同を避けるために補足しました。
sen.e: Go (a unit) is a unit of cubic volume in old Japanese system of weights and measures.

sen.j: 升の10分の1で、勺の10倍である。
sen.e: Go is one tenth of sho (unit of volume, approx. 1.8 liters) and ten times of shaku (18 ml, or 0.033 meters square, or one-hundredth of a tsubo).
Go is a 10th of sho (unit of volume) and 10 times of shaku (18 milliliters).
Go is a 10th of sho (unit of volume) and 10 times of shaku (18 milliliters).

sen.j: 日本では、明治時代に1升約1.8039リットルと定められたので、1合は約0.18039リットル（180.39ミリリットル）となる。
sen.e: As in Japan one sho was determined to be approximately 1.8039 liters during Meiji period, one go is to be 0.18039 liters (180.39 milliliters).
As in Japan 1 sho was determined to be approximately 1.8039 liters during Meiji period, 1 go is to be 0.18039 liters (180.39 milliliters).
sen.cmt: 体積に関する説明のため、アラビア数字にしました。
sen.e: As in Japan 1 sho was determined to be approximately 1.8039 liters during Meiji period, 1 go is to be 0.18039 liters (180.39 milliliters).

sen.j: 中国では、1升1リットルであるので、1合は100ミリリットルとなる。
sen.e: In China one sho equals to one liter, so one go is 100 milliliters.
In China 1 sho equals to 1 liter, so 1 go is 100 milliliters.
sen.cmt: 体積に関する説明のため、アラビア数字にしました。
sen.e: In China 1 sho equals to 1 liter, so 1 go is 100 milliliters.

sen.j: 日本では商取引での尺貫法の単位の使用は禁止されているが、今日でも、一部の酒類の販売は1合（180ミリリットル）単位で行われている。
sen.e: In Japan the use of shakkanho in business transaction is forbidden, but today in some of sales of alcoholic liquor the unit of go (one go = 180 milliliters) is used.

In Japan the use of the old Japanese system of weights and measures in business transaction is forbidden, but today in some of sales of alcoholic liquor the unit of go (1 go is equivalent to 180 milliliters) is used.
sen.cmt: 体積に関する説明のため、アラビア数字にしました。
sen.e: In Japan the use of the old Japanese system of weights and measures in business transaction is forbidden, but today in some of sales of alcoholic liquor the unit of go (1 go is equivalent to 180 milliliters) is used.

sen.j: また、1合の米は標準的な1食分の分量となっており、1合を量るための計量カップが広く使われている。
sen.e: Also, one go of rice is a volume of a standard meal and a measuring cup is widely used to measure one go.
Also, 1 go of rice is a volume of 1 standard meal and a measuring cup is widely used to measure 1 go.
sen.cmt: 体積に関する説明のため、アラビア数字にしました。
sen.e: Also, 1 go of rice is a volume of 1 standard meal and a measuring cup is widely used to measure 1 go.

sen.j: 漢代の長さの標準器であった黄鐘管を満たす水の量の2倍の量に由来するもので、2倍であるので「合」という名称となった。
sen.e: The name "go" comes from the volume which corresponds to the two times larger than the amount of water filling up a oshikikan (yellow bell tube, a kind of flute), the standard of length during the age of the Han dynasty.
sen.cmt: 「黄鐘管」を、oshikikan (yellow bell tube, a kind of flute)としました。
sen.e: The name 'go' comes from the volume which corresponds to the two times larger than the amount of water filling up a oshikikan (yellow bell tube, a kind of flute), the standard of length during the age of the Han Dynasty, then it was named 'go' (combination).

The name 'go' comes from the volume which corresponds to the two times larger than the amount of water filling up a oshikikan (yellow bell tube, a kind of flute), the standard of length during the age of the Han Dynasty, then it was named 'go' (combination).

sen.j: 後に升と関連づけられてその10分の1の量とされるようになった。
sen.e: Later it was related with sho and was determined as one tenth amount of sho.
Later it was related with sho and was determined as 1 10th amount of sho.
sen.cmt: 体積に関する説明のため、アラビア数字にしました。
sen.e: Later it was related with sho and was determined as 1 10th amount of sho.

sen.j: そこから「合」自体が「10分の1の量」という意味となり、下記のような地積（面積）の単位や登山道の目安を表す単位が生まれた。
sen.e: For this reason "go" itself came to mean "one tenth amount" and the following units of square footage or rough indication in a route of the climb were given rise to.
For this reason 'go' itself came to mean 'a 10th amount' and the following units of square footage (area) or rough indication in a route of the climb were given rise to.
sen.cmt: 体積に関する説明のため、アラビア数字にしました。
sen.e: For this reason 'go' itself came to mean 'a 10th amount' and the following units of square footage (area) or rough indication in a route of the climb were given rise to.

sen.j: どちらも、その10分の1を勺としている。
sen.e: One tenth of both of them is one shaku.
One tenth of both of them is 1 shaku.
sen.cmt: 体積に関する説明のため、アラビア数字にしました。
sen.e: One tenth of both of them is 1 shaku.

sen.j: 尺貫法における面積の単位。
sen.e: The unit of square footage in shakkanho.
The unit of area in the old Japanese system of weights and measures.
The unit of area in the old Japanese system of weights and measures.

sen.j: 坪（歩）の10分の1で、約0.3306平方メートル。
sen.e: It is one tenth of tsubo (unit of land measurement; 3.95 square yards; 3.31 square meters, (bu (unit of land measurement))) and approximately 0.3306 square meters.
It is a 10th of tsubo (unit of area) and approximately 0.3306 square meters.
sen.cmt: 体積に関する説明のため、アラビア数字にしました。
sen.e: It is a 10th of tsubo (unit of area) and approximately 0.3306 square meters.

sen.j: 登山道の到達の目安を示す単位。
sen.e: The unit of rough indication for accession in a route of the climb.
The unit of rough indication for accession in a route of the climb.
The unit of rough indication for accession in a route of the climb.

sen.j: 麓から頂上までを10合に分けるが、単純に高さや距離で等分しているのではなく、実際に歩いて登る際に要する時間がおおよその基準になっているため、険しい場所や坂の急な場所では1合の長さが短くなる。
sen.e: The distance from a foot of mountain to the summit is divided into ten go, and it is not simply divided equally with the height or distance but the rough criterion is the time which it takes to climb up by walking and thus the length of go is shortened in a steep place.
sen.cmt: 「険しい」も「坂の急な」も同義ととらえ、その冗長を一括、steepとしました。
sen.e: The distance from a foot of mountain to the summit is divided into 10 go, and it is not simply divided equally with the height or distance but the rough criterion is the time which it takes to climb up by walking and thus the length of 1 go is shortened in a steep place.
sen.cmt: アラビア数字にしました。
sen.e: The distance from a foot of mountain to the summit is divided into 10 go, and it is not simply divided equally with the height or distance but the rough criterion is the time which it takes to climb up by walking and thus the length of 1 go is shortened in a steep place.

tit.e: The change of weight in rice polishing.
The Change of Weight in Rice Polishing
tit.cmt: ピリオド削除しました。
tit.e: The Change of Weight in Rice Polishing

sen.j: 籾米1合(約110ｇ) →精製→生玄米0.5合(約78g) + 籾殻0.5合(約32g)
sen.e: Rice with husks one go (about 110g)=>polished=>raw brown (unpolished) rice 0.5 go (about 78g) + husks 0.5 go (about 32g)
From 1 go (about 110 grams) of rice with husks, after polished, 0.5 go (about 78 grams) of raw brown (unpolished) rice and 0.5 go (about 32 grams) of husks are made.
From 1 go (about 110 grams) of rice with husks, after polished, 0.5 go (about 78 grams) of raw brown (unpolished) rice and 0.5 go (about 32 grams) of husks are made.

sen.j: 生玄米1合(約156g)→精製→生白米5/6合(約125g)+ 糠1/6合(約31g)｛湿潤時の場合｝
sen.e: Raw brown (unpolished) rice 1go (about 156g) => polished => raw polished rice 5/6 go (about 125g) + rice bran 1/6 go (about 31g) ｛in the case of moistening}

From 1 go (about 156 grams) of raw brown (unpolished) rice, after polished, 5 over 6 go (about 125 grams) of raw polished rice and 1 over 6 go (about 31 grams) of rice bran are made (in the case of moistening).

From 1 go (about 156 grams) of raw brown (unpolished) rice, after polished, 5 over 6 go (about 125 grams) of raw polished rice and 1 over 6 go (about 31 grams) of rice bran are made (in the case of moistening).
Raw polished rice 1 go (about 150g)
1 go (about 150 grams) of raw polished rice
1 go (about 150 grams) of raw polished rice

tit.cmt: ピリオド削除しました。

sen.j: 精米した白米を炊く事で、質量・重量とも大幅(約2.2倍)に増加する。
sen.e: By steaming polished rice, it largely increases in volume and weight (about 2.2 times).
By steaming polished rice, it largely increases in volume and weight (about 2.2 times).
By steaming polished rice, it largely increases in volume and weight (about 2.2 times).

sen.j: 生白米1合(約150g)→炊飯→炊飯米1合(約330g)
sen.e: Raw polished rice one go (about 150g) => steamed => steamed rice one go (about 330g).
From 1 go (about 150grams) of raw polished rice, after steamed, 1 go (about 330grams) of steamed rice is made.
From 1 go (about 150grams) of raw polished rice, after steamed, 1 go (about 330grams) of steamed rice is made.
